nameOrPath.description: Name or path for the worktree
nameOrPath.name: nameOrPath

branch.description: Branch to use for the worktree
branch.name: branch

add.description:
Creates a new git worktree at the specified location.

    The NAME_OR_PATH can be:
      - A simple name (e.g., 'feature'): Creates in configured worktrees_dir
      - A relative path (e.g., '../projects/feature'): Creates at that path
      - An absolute path: Creates at the exact location
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature          # Create worktree at ../feature using existing branch
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature main     # Create worktree using 'main' branch
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature -b new   # Create worktree with new branch 'new'
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature -t origin/develop  # Track remote branch
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> ../custom/path   # Create at specific path

branch.name: branch
branch.summary: Create a new branch for the worktree

force.name: force
force.summary: Force creation even if directory exists

init.description:
Creates a .worktree.yml configuration file in your repository.

    This command copies the example configuration file to your current directory,
    allowing you to customize worktree settings and hooks.

jump.description:
Navigate to a worktree directory.
    
    If no worktree name is provided, shows an interactive selection menu.
    The command outputs only the path for use with cd command.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature   # Jump to worktree with name containing "feature"

list.description:
Displays all git worktrees in the current repository.

    This command can be run from either the main repository or any worktree.
    When run from a worktree, it shows the path to the main repository.

nameOrPath.description: Name or path of the worktree to remove
nameOrPath.name: nameOrPath

remove.description:
Remove a git worktree from the repository.
    
    If no worktree is specified, shows an interactive selection menu.
    The --all flag removes all worktrees at once (with confirmation).
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> feature   # Remove worktree named "feature"
<%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --force   # Force removal even with changes

force.name: force
force.summary: Force removal even if worktree has changes

reset.description:
Reset the current worktree branch to origin/main (or configured main branch).
    
    This command must be run from a worktree, not from the main repository.
    It will fetch the latest changes from origin and reset the current branch.
examples: <%= config.bin %> <%= command.id %> --force # Force reset even with uncommitted changes

force.name: force
force.summary: Force reset even if there are uncommitted changes

reset.summary: Reset current worktree branch to origin/main
